subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
Simplified from earlier {{zh-l|*灋}}, which was originally used to represent {{och-l|廢|to cast aside; to abrogate}}.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Sino-Tibetan. Cognate with {{cog|bo|བབས||shape, form, appearance}}, {{m|bo|དབྱིབས||shape, form, figure}}. Possibly cognate with {{och-l|凡|all, general, every; pattern, general rule}}; see there for more.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=fǎ,fā,fá,fà
|m_note=fǎ - normal pronunciation; fā - used in some colloquial words (e.g. {{zh-l|*法兒|method}} in {{zh-l|[[沒]][[法兒]]}} and {{zh-l|[[想]][[個]][[法兒]]}}); fá - used in {{zh-l|*法子|method}} and {{zh-l|*法兒|method}}; fà - originally Beijing dialect, also a common variant in Taiwan, used for “France; French”
